pageContext.associations: 17 socketed celts + 3 other pieces of bronze (2? sword fragments; the ploughshare struck where they were all "candied" together. Another larger celt was found later and a jet of metal and a small broken speciment another time. 8 socketed celts, a jet and an oval fragment are in British Museum.
pageContext.publications: Archaeol. Journal, X, pp. 69-71, illust.,Evans, Anc. Br. Imps., Hoard No. 91, pp. 113, 118, 120, 424, 467
pageContext.site: England,Lincolnshire,West Halton,Found in ploughing on Mr. Burkill's land in the Old Cow Pasture, by the sand-drain which falls into the Winteringham Have, N. of road to Winterton.,17 December 1852
pageContext.toSearch: West Halton, Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire Dn15, UK
